thread.title: Bills: Tyrod Taylor to miss some games
thread.title_full: Bills: Tyrod Taylor to miss some games

title: Bills: Tyrod Taylor to miss some games
text:
Bills: Tyrod Taylor to miss some games 
Updated: Tuesday, October 13 2015, 06:46 PM EDT 
Buffalo, N.Y. - The Buffalo Bills made a move Tuesday that could be a sign of some quarterback concerns. 
Monday, Head Coach Rex Ryan said Tyrod Taylor was sore and "beat up" after Sunday's game. There is now word there may be more to that report. 
Reports from around the country, including ESPN, indicate Taylor has a sprained MCL in his knee and will likely miss a few weeks. The injury reportedly happened on his run in the fourth quarter of the Bills' game against the Titans - a play which helped Buffalo win. Taylor was taken down awkwardly, left the game for a play, but then came back. 
Coach Ryan will not have a news conference until Wednesday, but the Bills tipped their hand a bit by signing quarterback Josh Johnson. It appears E.J. Manuel will start Sunday against the Bengals, as well as in London against Jacksonville. The Bills have a bye week after that game. Bills: Tyrod Taylor to miss some games Related Stories
